subject: Physical Fitness
title: Hydration and Muscle Function
description: A fast breakdown of Hydration and Muscle Function for builders.

hook.text: Muscle is about 75% water. Lose just 2% of body water and performance drops measurably.

buildup.text: Water carries nutrients to muscles, removes waste, and helps regulate temperature during exercise.

discovery.text: Dehydrated muscles cramp more, produce less force, and fatigue faster. Reaction time slows too.

twist.text: Thirst is a late signal. By the time you feel thirsty, you've already lost enough fluid to hurt output.

climax.text: Drinking small amounts regularly beats gulping large amounts after. Steady hydration sustains performance.

punchline.text: Water is the cheapest performance enhancer. Most people don't drink enough.

quiz.question: At what level of dehydration does performance measurably drop?
